system.description:
You create an area of swirling, chaotic magical energies. The spell’s area is lightly obscured by colorful lights and mist. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is subjected to a random magical effect. Roll on the table below for details.

d6Effect
1The creature undergoes some bizarre cosmetic change. Its skin turns a vibrant shade unnatural to its heritage, its hair becomes metallic, its eyes glow different colors, etc. The change fades slowly over the next hour.
2The creature’s is Encumbered until the beginning of its next turn
3The creature takes 6d6 psychic damage.
4The creature is poisoned and confused until the beginning of its next turn.
5The creature gains advantage on attacks until the beginning of its next turn.
6The creature heals 2d6 hit points.

Cast at Higher Levels. If you cast this spell with a 5th-level spell slot, the table gains the following two entries; roll a d8 instead of a d6.

7The creature gains two levels of strife.
8The creature ends a condition of its choice that is on it. It cannot remove the petrified or doomed conditions this way.

If you cast this spell with a 6th-level spell slot, the table gains the following additional 2 entries cumulative with the new ones added for a 5th-level spell slot; roll a d10 instead of a d6.

9The creature falls asleep as the sleep spell.
10The creature gains inspiration.

If you cast this spell with a 7th- or 8th- level spell slot, the table gains the following additional 2 entries cumulative with the new ones added for a 5th and a 6th-level spell slot; roll a d12 instead of a d6.

11The creature is thrown 2d10 x 10 feet into the air and falls normally.
12The creature recovers an expended 1st-level spell slot or 2 points of exertion (creature’s choice).

If you cast this spell with a 9th- level spell slot, the spell’s area doubles and the table gains the following additional 8 entries cumulative with the new ones added for 5th-8th -level spell slots; roll a d20 instead of a d6.

13The creature is paralyzed until the beginning of its next turn.
14The creature gains 1d4 levels of fatigue.
15The creature is blinded and its speed is halved until the beginning of its next turn.
16The creature catches fire and takes 3d6 ongoing fire damage for the next minute unless an action is taken by the creature or one of its allies to extinguish the flames.
17 The creature permanently gains some small new physical attribute like horns, a crest of feathers, a patch of colorful scales, or the like. The new feature can be removed with remove curse or similar magic.
18 The creature recovers a level of fatigue and a level of strife. If it has neither, it gains 2d6 temporary hit points instead.
19 The creature’s AC increases by +5 until the beginning of its next turn.
20 The creature is immune to all damage until the beginning of its next turn.
